data.heading: Scope
data.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) [SOURCE: ISO 24315-1:2024, 3.3.2.3] provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using the road network.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

The scope of METR includes the networks for pedestrians, public-area mobile robots (PMRs), micromobility vehicles, and motor vehicles.

This document defines the requirements for a METR component system that is responsible for maintaining copies of relevant transport-related rules for a METR user and reporting any detected discrepancies among rules. This document is presented in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. 

For an understanding of how the METR user system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-3. The operational concept for METR is provided in ISO 24315-2.

attributesChanged.text:
The management of electronic transport regulations (METR) provides trustworthy, authoritative, machine-interpretable, transport-related rules for using surface transport facilities.

The scope of METR includes both rules that are relatively static (e.g., static speed limits) as well as those that are dynamic (e.g., variable speed limits, lane closures at incident scenes). However, where appropriate, METR is expected to incorporate existing standards (e.g., ISO/TS 19091 for signalized intersections).

This document defines the system requirements for a METR user system in a format that is consistent with the guidance provided by ISO 29148 [2] for a system requirements document. 

For an understanding of how the METR distribution system fits into the larger METR system of systems, see ISO 24315-2. The operational concept for METR is provided in ISO 24315-1.

** Editor's Note: This draft document is generated from a requirements management tool. Headings within the draft document include a reference within square brackets (e.g., "[SoSR-35]") that indicate the source location of the text to assist in maintaining the text. These references will be removed in the final text. Text demarked with double asterisks ("**") are editorial notes that will be removed from the final draft. **

data.heading: Normative references
data.text: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some, or all, of their content constitutes requirements of this document. For dated references, only the edition cited applies. For undated references, the latest edition of the referenced document (including any amendments) applies.

children.text: ISO/TS 14812, Intelligent transport systems — Vocabulary
ISO/TS 24315-1, Intelligent transport systems — Management of electronic traffic regulations (METR) — Part 1: Vocabulary
ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, Systems and software engineering — Vocabulary

data.heading: Terms and definitions
data.text:
For the purposes of this document, the terms and definitions given in ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, ISO/TS 14812 and ISO 24315-1 apply.

ISO and IEC maintain terminology databases for use in standardization at the following addresses:

•   ISO Online browsing platform: available at https://www.iso.org/obp

•   IEC Electropedia: available at https://www.electropedia.org

children.heading: General
children.text: Figure 1 identifies the incoming and outgoing information flows for a METR consumer system per the reference architecture, which is defined in full in Clause 8 of the SoSR (ISO 24315-3).

children.heading: MCS information flows
children.text: The MCS-related information transfers (i.e., source, destination, and information flow) identified in the figure include the following, which are defined in detail in Clause 6:
CV RSE -> METR user device: local METR information for users
CV RSE -> METR user device: supporting data

attributesChanged.text: MDC -> METR user device: supporting data

children.text: MDC -> METR user device: METR information for users
METR user -> METR user device: supporting data

attributesChanged.text: METYR user -> METR user device: supporting data

children.text: METR user device -> MDHC: METR discrepancy report
METR user device -> METR user: user updates
Supporting data provider -> METR user device: supporting data
SV OBE -> METR user device: local METR information for users

children.heading: Internal interfaces
children.text: This document does not place requirements on the internal interfaces of the physical object that houses the regulation system, but Clause 8 does define the internal interfaces that are expected to exist per the ConOps. In these cases, it uses a "should" statement rather than a "shall" statement.

children.text: The METR user system shall monitor for the publication of ad-hoc rules according to the communication technologies and parameters identified within the rule catalogue for the relevant area.

children.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the ad-hoc rules.

children.heading: Locate rules
children.text: The user system shall correlate the location of each rule with respect to the physical world.

children.heading: Information flow: Object discovery
children.text: As needed to fulfil its other requirements, the METR user system shall query a discovery system to determine relevant information for the following ITS services:

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall be aware of the pre-announced rule disseminators for its relevant coverage area.

The METR user system shall be aware of the pre-announced rule disseminators for its relevant coverage area.

NOTE: The relevant coverage area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

The METR user system shall be aware of the pre-announced rule disseminators for its relevant operational area.

NOTE: The relevant coverage area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

The METR user system shall be aware of the pre-announced rule disseminators for its relevant operational area.

NOTE: The relevant operational area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

Prior to obtaining pre-announced rules for a relevant area, the METR user system shall identify an appropriate pre-announced rule disseminator.

NOTE: The relevant operational area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

Prior to obtaining pre-announced rules for a relevant area, the METR user system shall identify an appropriate pre-announced rule disseminator for the area.

NOTE: The relevant operational area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

Prior to obtaining pre-announced rules for a relevant area, the METR user system shall determine an appropriate pre-announced rule disseminator for the area.

NOTE: The relevant operational area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

Prior to obtaining pre-announced rules for a relevant area, the METR user system shall determine an appropriate pre-announced rule distribution system for the defined area.

NOTE: The relevant area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

As needed to fulfil its other requirements, the METR user system shall query a discovery system to determine relevant network addresses for the following ITS services:


Prior to obtaining pre-announced rules for a relevant area, the METR user system shall determine an appropriate pre-announced rule distribution system for the defined area.

NOTE: The relevant area can include areas at a distance in the case of trip planning.

children.heading: Information flow: METR status information
children.text: Upon request from an on-board system, the METR user system shall obtain information regarding locations that have degraded operations.

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall obtain relevant status information on METR network components, as needed.
Upon user request, the METR user system shall obtain relevant status information on METR network components.
Upon user request, the METR user system shall obtain status information on relevant METR network components.
Upon user request, the METR user system shall obtain status information on relevant METR network components.
Upon request from an on-board , the METR user system shall obtain status information on relevant METR network components.

Upon request from an on-board system, the METR user system shall obtain information regarding locations that have degraded operations.

NOTE 1: Degraded operations occur when the distribution system is unable to provide rules that are not nearing their expiration times.

children.text: Degraded operations occur when the distribution system is unable to provide rules that are not nearing their expiration times.

children.heading: Information flow: METR information for consumers

attributesChanged.heading: Provide rules to requesters
attributesChanged.text:
Based on criteria defined by the requesting system, the METR dissemination functional object shall provide the requesting system with all relevant pre-announced rules of which it is aware.

NOTE: The METR dissemination function object can also provide ad-hoc rules.
The METR user functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized dissemination system based on its defined criteria.
The METR reception functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized dissemination system based on its defined criteria.
The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized dissemination system based on its defined criteria.

The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized dissemination system based on criteria established by the user system.

EXAMPLE   A vehicle-based system will typically need to establish criteria based on its location and vehicle category.

The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized dissemination system based on criteria established by the user system.

EXAMPLE   A vehicle-based system will typically need to establish criteria based on its location and vehicle category.

NOTE: The request can be in the form of a subscription that imposes a requirement upon the distribution system to provide updates to the reception functional object, as needed.

The METR user system shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules from an authorized distribution system based on criteria established by the user system.

EXAMPLE   A vehicle-based system will typically need to establish criteria based on its location, its planned route, and vehicle category.

NOTE: The request can be in the form of a (1) query or (2) subscription that imposes a requirement upon the distribution system to provide updates to the reception functional object, as needed.

children.heading: Information content
children.text: The “METR information for users” flow shall include:
relevant rules and meta-data;
the boundaries of each relevant sub-area;
jurisdictional vocabulary

children.heading: Source identification
children.text: The METR user system shall obtain the “METR information for users” flow from one or more distribution systems.

children.heading: Causality
children.text: The METR user system shall initiate the “METR information for users” flow as directed by the METR interpretation functional object.
The direction can be a direct request or a standing subscription.

children.heading: Location constraint
children.text: As directed by the METR interpretation functional object, the METR user system shall specify relevant location criteria to be used for the “METR information for users” flow, such as:

attributesChanged.text: The direction can be a direct request or a standing subscription.

children.text: proximity from a point location;
proximity along a route;
geofenced area.

children.heading: Constraints based on characteristics
children.text: As directed by authorized the METR interpretation functional object, the METR user system shall specify appropriate relevancy criteria to be used for the “METR information for users” flow, including:
manually implemented vehicle characteristics (e.g. addition of a trailer)
static vehicle characteristics;
user characteristics;
(others as deemed appropriate in req’ts phase)

children.heading: Obtain METR information as directed
children.text: The METR user system shall initiate “METR information for users” flows, as needed, to respond to requests from the METR interpretation functional object.

children.heading: Update frequency
children.text: The METR user system shall initiate “METR information for users” flows to update METR information that the METR interpretation functional object indicates is still relevant. Attempts to update this information shall start no later than the informationRefreshDuration time prior to the expiration time of the relevant METR information.

children.heading: Latency
children.text: The METR user system shall make obtained METR information available to the interpretation functional object within the receiverLatency time.

children.heading: Verify information
children.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the received METR information.

children.heading: General
children.text: The METR user system shall obtain relevant METR information from an authorized distribution system based on criteria established by the requesting, authorized on-board component, including:

attributesChanged.text:

EXAMPLE   A vehicle-based system will typically need to establish criteria based on its location, its planned route, and vehicle category.

NOTE: The request can be in the form of a (1) query or (2) subscription that imposes a requirement upon the distribution system to provide updates to the reception functional object, as needed.

children.heading: METR information criteria
children.text: The METR user system shall allow authorized on-board components to request METR information subject to any or all of the following criteria:

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall allow authorized on-board components to request rules subject to any or all of the following criteria:

children.text: user characteristics (including permits);

attributesChanged.text: user permits
user characteristics (including permits)

children.text: vehicle characteristics (including permits); and

vehicle characteristics (including permits);

children.heading: METR information criteria updates
children.text: As directed by its authorized on-board components, the METR user system shall update its established criteria with the distribution system within the criteriaLatencyTime.

attributesChanged.text: The METR reception functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed.
The METR reception functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to take any necessary action.

The METR reception functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to take any necessary action.

EXAMPLE   A reception functional object within a vehicle needs to request rules related to stop sign locations early enough so that the host vehicle can process the data and safely bring the vehicle to a stop prior to reaching the location of any stop sign.

The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to take any necessary action.

EXAMPLE   A reception functional object within a vehicle needs to request rules related to stop sign locations early enough so that the host vehicle can process the data and safely bring the vehicle to a stop prior to reaching the location of any stop sign.

The METR reception functional object shall obtain relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to take any necessary action.

EXAMPLE   A reception functional object within a vehicle needs to request rules related to stop sign locations early enough so that the host vehicle can process the data and safely bring the vehicle to a stop prior to reaching the location of any stop sign.

The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to safely obey current rules.

EXAMPLE   A reception functional object within a vehicle needs to request rules related to stop sign locations early enough so that the host vehicle can process the data and safely bring the vehicle to a stop prior to reaching the location of any stop sign.

The METR reception functional object shall request relevant pre-announced rules prior to when they are needed to safely obey current rules.

EXAMPLE   A reception functional object within a vehicle needs to request rules related to stop sign locations early enough so that the host vehicle can process the data and safely bring the vehicle to a stop prior to reaching the location of any stop sign.

NOTE: A reception functional object can prioritize the delivery of rules by making multiple requests with the request for the most critical rules submitted first.

attributesChanged.heading: Request rules prior to need
attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall request relevant pre-announced rules within userLatency time of when location(s) are identified by authorized on-board components.

attributesChanged.heading: Location-based request
attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall establish its location criteria as directed by its authorized on-board components.
The METR user system shall establish its criteria as directed by its authorized on-board components.
As directed by its authorized on-board components, the METR user system shall update its established criteria with the distribution system within the ruleCriteriaUpdateLatency time.

attributesChanged.heading: Rule criteria
attributesChanged.text: As directed by its authorized on-board components, the METR user system shall update its established criteria with the distribution system within the ruleCriteriaUpdateLatency time.

children.heading: Update METR information prior to expiration
children.text: The METR user system shall update currently relevant METR information prior to its expiration.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR user functional object shall refresh its pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE: The expiration time can be different among rules.

The METR reception functional object shall refresh its pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE: The expiration time can be different among rules.

The METR reception functional object shall refresh relevant pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE: The expiration time can be different among rules.

The METR reception functional object shall request a refresh of relevant pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE: The expiration time can be different among rules.

The METR user system shall request a refresh of relevant pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE: The expiration time can be different among rules.

attributesChanged.heading: Update rules prior to expiration
attributesChanged.text:
The METR user system shall update currently relevant pre-announced rules prior to their expiration.

NOTE 1: The expiration time can be different among rules.

NOTE 2: The rules relevant to a user can change over time (e.g., based on the user's location and projected route).

attributesChanged.heading: Update METR iinformation prior to expiration

attributesChanged.text:
The METR user system shall update currently relevant METR information prior to its expiration.

NOTE 1: The expiration time can be different among information categories.

NOTE 2: The information relevant to a user can change over time (e.g., based on the user's location and projected route).

children.text: The expiration time can be different among information categories.
The information relevant to a user can change over time (e.g., based on the user's location and projected route).

children.heading: Verify information (METR information)
children.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the received METR information.

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the ad-hoc rules.

attributesChanged.heading: Verify information (transport rules)
attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the received rules.
The METR user system shall report the failure of any verification check to its associated discrepancy handler system, unless the issue is already flagged as a known issue.

children.heading: Generate reports for electronic discrepancies
children.text: Upon identifying a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall report any discovered discrepancy to its associated discrepancy handler system.
The METR user system shall report the failure of any verification check to its associated discrepancy handler system.
The METR user system shall report the failure of any verification check to its associated discrepancy handler system, unless the issue is already flagged as a known issue.
Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.
Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report, unless the issue is already flagged as a known issue.
Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report, unless the issue is already flagged as a known issue.
Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules that the either electronic rule has not flagged as a known issue, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.
Upon the METR user system detecting a potential inconsistency between electronic rules, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

children.heading: Generate reports for physical discrepancies
children.text: Upon notification from an on-board system of a potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

attributesChanged.text:
Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall translate and supplement the notice into a discrepancy report.

NOTE:   The translation can add timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall translate and supplement the notice into a discrepancy report.

NOTE:   The translation can add timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall translate and supplement the notice into a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The translation can add timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall translate the notice into a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The translation can add timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall generate a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The translation can add timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy handling system shall generate a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The discrepancy report can include timestamps and other meta-data as  appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification of a conflict or potential inconsistency from another authorized functional object internal to the user system, the METR discrepancy reporting functional object shall generate a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The discrepancy report can include timestamps and other meta-data as appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon detection of a conflict or potential inconsistency between an electronic and physical rule, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The discrepancy report can include timestamps and other meta-data as appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification from an on-board system of a conflict or potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule, the METR user system shall report the discrepancy when connectivity to the discrepancy handler system can be established.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The discrepancy report can include timestamps and other meta-data as appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification from an on-board system of a conflict or potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule, the METR user system shall report the discrepancy when connectivity to the discrepancy handler system can be established.

NOTE 1: The other functional object is typically either the METR reception functional object or the METR interpretation functional object.

NOTE 2: The discrepancy report can include timestamps and other meta-data as appropriate or necessary to conform to the interface standards to the discrepancy handling system.

Upon notification from an on-board system of a conflict or potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report, unless the discrepancy is already flagged as a known issue.

Upon notification from an on-board system of a potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule that the electronic rule has not flagged as a known issue, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report, unless the discrepancy is already flagged as a known issue.

Upon notification from an on-board system of a potential inconsistency between an electronic rule and a physical rule that the electronic rule has not flagged as a known issue, the METR user system shall generate a discrepancy report.

children.heading: Report discrepancies
children.text: The METR user system shall send each generated discrepancy report to the discrepancy handler system when connectivity to the discrepancy handler system can be established, unless each associated electronic rule has already flagged the discrepancy as a known issue.

attributesChanged.text: unless the issue is already flagged as a known issue
The METR user system shall send each generated discrepancy report to the discrepancy handler system when connectivity to the discrepancy handler system can be established.

The METR user system shall send each generated discrepancy report to the discrepancy handler system when connectivity to the discrepancy handler system can be established, unless the discrepancy is already flagged as a known issue.

children.heading: Log discrepancies
children.text: The METR user system shall log each generated discrepancy discovered and resultant actions taken.

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall log any discrepancies discovered and resultant actions taken.

children.heading: Verification process
children.text: The METR user system shall perform verification checks on all information received, including:

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall perform verification checks on the collected rules, including:
The METR user system shall perform verification checks on the collected rules, including:

children.text: verifying that each rule does not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., with any vocabulary term or other known rule);
children.title: Rule inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that any rule that has potential inconsistencies with vocabulary or other known rules is flagged as having a known issue;
verifying that each rule does not create a potential inconsistency with any vocabulary term or other known rule;
verifying that each rule does not create a potential inconsistency issues with any vocabulary term or other known rule;

children.text: verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not create any potential inconsistency issue (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);
children.title: Term inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not conflict (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);
verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not create inconsistency issues (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);
verifying that vocabulary term definitions do not create any inconsistency issue (e.g., different definitions for same term from two translators representing same jurisdiction);

children.text: verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not create any inconsistency;
children.title: Boundary inconsistency

attributesChanged.text: verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not conflict;
verifying that the boundaries of defined areas do not have inconsistencies;

children.heading: Performance requirement
children.text: The METR user system shall make all verified METR information available to  the METR interpreter functional object within the receiverVerificationTime from the receipt of information from the “METR information for users” flow.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall make all verified METR information available to "METR information for users” flows within the distributionVerificationTime from the receipt of information from the “METR information” flow.

children.heading: Default configuration
children.text: For each vehicle characteristic defined in ISO 14812, the METR user system shall initialize itself with a configuration value that represents the host vehicle for which rules are to be collected.

attributesChanged.text:
The METR user system shall initialize itself with default configuration values for the following characteristics of the host for which rules are to be collected. 

NOTE: Some default characteristics can be revised through the driver input flow.

The METR user system shall initialize itself with default configuration values for each vehicle characteristic of the host vehicle for which rules are to be collected. 

NOTE: Some default vehicle characteristics can be revised through the driver input flow.

NOTE 2: See ISO 14812 for a complete list of vehicle characteristics.

For each vehicle characteristic defined in ISO 14812, the METR user system shall initialize itself with a configuration value that represents the host vehicle for which rules are to be collected. 

NOTE: Some default vehicle characteristics can be revised through the driver input flow.

For each vehicle characteristic defined in ISO 14812, the METR user system shall initialize itself with a configuration value that represents the host vehicle for which rules are to be collected.

NOTE: Some default vehicle characteristics can be revised through the driver input flow.

children.text: Some default vehicle characteristics can be revised through the driver input flow.

children.heading: Use preferred communications
children.text: The METR user system shall use the configured communication preferences and available connections.

attributesChanged.text: The METR user system shall use communication pathways based on user preferences and available connections.

children.heading: Radio frequency regulations
children.text: The METR user system shall comply with local regulations for the use of radio frequencies.

attributesChanged.text: The METR distribution system shall comply with local regulations for the use of radio frequencies.

children.heading: Provide rule criteria
children.text: It is assumed that authorized on-board components will notify the METR user system of the following criteria in a timely manner:
locations of interest
rule categories of interest

children.heading: METR status
children.text: It is assumed that the METR user system will provide an interface for other authorized on-board components to determine the status of the relevant METR network.

attributesChanged.text: As needed, the METR distribution system shall provide its configuration and operational status to authorized external systems.

attributesChanged.heading: Monitor services
attributesChanged.text:
As needed, the METR user system shall provide its configuration and operational status to authorized external systems.

EXAMPLE  A fleet manager can monitor the status of the METR user system of one of the vehicles within its fleet.

It is assumed that the METR user system will provide an interface for other authorized on-board components to determine the status of the relevant METR network.

EXAMPLE  A fleet manager can monitor the status of the METR user system of one of the vehicles within its fleet.
It is assumed that the METR user system will provide an interface for other authorized on-board components to determine the status of the relevant METR network.

It is assumed that the METR user system will provide an interface for other authorized on-board components to determine the status of the relevant METR network.

NOTE: This includes areas with degraded service as well as any problems with the METR user system itself.

children.text: This includes areas with degraded service as well as any problems with the METR user system itself.

children.heading: Deliver rules
children.text: It is assumed that the METR user system will make received rules available to authorized on-board components near-instantaneously after receipt of the information.

attributesChanged.text: The METR reception functional object shall deliver any received ad-hoc rules to requesting functional objects within 100 ms of the later of the receipt of the ad-hoc rule or the request.
The METR reception functional object shall make any received ad-hoc rules available to requesting functional objects within 100 ms of the receipt of the ad-hoc rule.

The METR reception functional object shall make any received ad-hoc rules available to requesting functional objects within 100 ms of the receipt of the ad-hoc rule.

EXAMPLE   The METR Interpretation functional object is a typical requesting functional object

The METR reception functional object shall make each received ad-hoc rules available to requesting functional objects within 100 ms of the receipt of the ad-hoc rule.

EXAMPLE   The METR Interpretation functional object is a typical requesting functional object
The METR user system shall make each received ad-hoc rule available to requesting on-board system within 100 ms of the receipt of the ad-hoc rule.

children.heading: Internal data management
children.text: The METR user system should manage its internal database by:

attributesChanged.text: NOTE: See "verified discrepancies" in outgoing information flows for information on reporting any discovered discrepancies.

children.text: removing rules that are terminated;
children.title: Terminated rules

attributesChanged.text: verifying that terminated rules have been removed;

children.text: removing any duplicate rules (e.g., received from different sources); and
children.title: Duplicate rules

attributesChanged.text: verifying that any duplicate rules are removed;
verifying that there are not any duplicate rules;
removing any duplicate rules;

children.text: removing old versions of updated rules (i.e., with the same identifier).
children.title: Updated rules

attributesChanged.text: verifying that old versions of updated rules (i.e., with the same identifier) are removed;

children.heading: Discrepancy notification
children.text: Authorized on-board components can have the ability to detect physical rules (e.g., through the use of video image processing). When discrepancies are detected between electronic rules and physical rules, it is assumed that the authorized on-board components will notify the METR user system.

attributesChanged.text: It is assumed that the authorized on-board components will have the capability to detect physical rules (e.g., through the use of video image processing). When discrepancies are detected between electronic rules and physical rules the authorized

It is assumed that the authorized on-board components will have the capability to detect physical rules (e.g., through the use of video image processing). When discrepancies are detected between electronic rules and physical rules the authorized on-board components should notify

It is assumed that the authorized on-board components will have the capability to detect physical rules (e.g., through the use of video image processing). When discrepancies are detected between electronic rules and physical rules the authorized on-board components should notify the METR user system.

Authorized on-board components can detect physical rules (e.g., through the use of video image processing). When discrepancies are detected between electronic rules and physical rules, it is assumed that the authorized on-board components will notify the METR user system.

children.heading: Provide terms of service
children.text: The METR user system should allow authorized on-board components to access the terms of service of the current METR distribution system.

attributesChanged.heading: Provide terms of service
attributesChanged.text: Upon request for METR services that references an outdated terms of service, the METR distribution system shall provide the current terms of service to the requesting METR user system.

attributesChanged.heading: Maintain awareness of terms of service
attributesChanged.text:
With each request for pre-announced rules, the METR user system shall indicate the terms of service it is basing its request upon. 

NOTE: If the referenced terms of service are not current, the distribution system will provide updated terms.

children.heading: Maintain awareness of communication preferences
children.text: The METR user system should allow authorized on-board components to monitor and configure the user's preferred communication preferences.

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall be aware of the user's preferred communication pathways.
The METR user system shall be aware of the user's preferred communication pathways.
The METR user system shall be aware of the user's preferred communication preferrences.
The METR user system shall be aware of the user's preferred communication preferences.

children.heading: Maintain awareness of user characteristics
children.text: Authorized on-board components are responsible for informing the METR user system of any changes to the vehicle, usage, or user characteristics (e.g., addition of a trailer, type of load, user permissions)

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall be aware of official permits granted to the user and/or the relevant vehicle.
The METR user system shall be aware of official permits granted to the user and/or the relevant vehicle.
Authorized on-board components are responsible for informing the METR user system of any changes to the vehicle, usage, or user characteristics (e.g., addition of a trailer, user permissions)

children.heading: Request relevant METR information
children.text: It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to determine the user's relevant location(s) and to submit appropriate requests for relevant METR information to the METR user system.

attributesChanged.heading: Determine user's location
attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall use the user's location to determine what rules are currently relevant.
It is the responsibility of the user system to determine the user's relevant location(s) and thereby determine what rules are currently relevant.

attributesChanged.heading: Determine user's relevant location
attributesChanged.text: It is the responsibility of the user system to determine the user's relevant location(s) and thereby determine what rules are relevant.
It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to determine the user's relevant location(s), submit requests for relevant rules to the METR user system.
It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to determine the user's relevant location(s) and to submit appropriate requests for relevant rules to the METR user system.

children.heading: Mapping of METR information
children.text: It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to obtain appropriate maps and to overlay METR information onto these maps with sufficient accuracy for the purpose of the information.

attributesChanged.heading: Location entry
attributesChanged.text:
It is the responsibility of the translator agent to enter each location associated with each each METR information item such that it can be overlaid onto any map with sufficient accuracy for the purpose of the information.

NOTE: Different types of rules will have different accuracy requirements. For example, a jurisdiction can adopt a policy that speed limit zones are defined with 1 meter accuracy while parking spaces are defined with 1 cm accuracy.

NOTE 2: In order to achieve the desired level of accuracy when overlaid onto different maps, the location can be indicated with a location reference that refers to a distance from a known and identifiable point (e.g., the stop sign rule is applied at the marked stop bar).

It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to obtain appropriate maps and to overlay METR information onto these maps with sufficient accuracy for the purpose of the information.

NOTE: Different types of rules will have different accuracy requirements. For example, a jurisdiction can adopt a policy that speed limit zones are defined with 1 meter accuracy while parking spaces are defined with 1 cm accuracy.

children.text: Different types of rules will have different accuracy requirements. For example, a jurisdiction can adopt a policy that speed limit zones are defined with 1 meter accuracy while parking spaces are defined with 1 cm accuracy.

children.heading: Rule discovery
children.text: It is the responsibility of the authorized on-board components to detect physical rules and to notify the METR user system when these rules should be reported to the managing translator system as a part of a rule discovery process.

children.heading: Determine relevant permissions
children.text: It is the responsibility of the user system to be aware of the set of permits that are applicable for the user and thereby determine what rules are relevant.

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall use information from the user's and vehicle's current set of permits  that are loaded into the vehicle to determine what rules are currently relevant.
It is the responsibility of the user system to be aware of the current set of permits that are applicable for the user and thereby determine what rules are currently relevant.

children.heading: Determine environmental conditions
children.text: It is the responsibility of the user system to determine the relevant environmental conditions and thereby determine what rules are relevant.

attributesChanged.text: The METR network shall use relevant environmental conditions to determine what rules are currently relevant.
